textObjects.m_Content: We are going to create a part of the "Place an External Ventricular Drain" training. Now, say "Next Phase" to start the tutorial. The current phase is displayed on top of the main menu panel.

1. Click "Text" on the main menu, then click "Add" in the popped up submenu.
2. Click "Edit Title", say something (e.g. "step one"), and click "Stop Editing Title".
3. Check if the title is correct. If not, repeat step 2.
4. Try editing the content! (e.g. "elevate the bed")

1. Click "2D", then click "Upload".
2. Pick a picture in the pop-up window, e.g. "Prep"
3. An image panel will appear. Use your hand to move it.
4. Try edit the title using your voice!

1. Add a Cube from 3D submenu.
2. Click the gear icon next to the cube. A menu will be opened up.
3. Click "Anchor to Display". Now the cube will move with your head.
4. Click "Anchor to Display" again. Now the cube is no longer anchored.

1. Add a Cube. Open its submenu.
2. Click "Set as anchor". Now this is the object anchor.
3. Add an Arrow from the 3D menu. You mind need to move the cube to see the arrow.
4. Move the arrow so it's pointing to the cube. 
5. Open the arrow's submenu. Click "Anchor to the Object". Now the arrow will follow the cube.
6. Look away. You'll see a small error pointing back towards the cube.

1. Make sure that the full real skull model is in your view.
2. Click "Track" -> "Skull" -> "Toggle Model Track". Look at the skull until you see an overlay.
3. Move around but keep looking at the model.
